articles.title: Jets coach dismisses Hall trade chatter: 'Rumors'
articles.summary: Jets coach Aaron Glenn dismissed the renewed trade speculation surrounding Breece Hall, reiterating what he said in the preseason: They have no plans to trade their No. 1 running back.

articles.title: Jaguars eyeing bigger offensive role for Hunter
articles.summary: The Jaguars are making it a priority to design and call bigger offensive plays for Travis Hunter to take advantage of his speed, coach Liam Coen said.

articles.title: Commanders WR Brown on IR with groin injury
articles.summary: The Commanders placed receiver Noah Brown on injured reserve, four games after he initially injured his groin and robbing the offense of getting back another potential playmaker.

articles.title: Campbell expects Lions' McNeill to play vs. Bucs
articles.summary: Lions coach Dan Campbell says he expects Alim McNeill to return from a knee injury and play Monday against the Buccaneers.

articles.title: Cards TE Vokolek to IR, out for rest of season
articles.summary: Cardinals tight end Travis Vokolek went on injured reserve with a neck injury Wednesday and will miss the rest of the season.

articles.title: Jones: Boys 'still in it,' open to defensive trade
articles.summary: Despite his team's uneven 2-3-1 start to the season, Cowboys owner Jerry Jones believes his team is "still in it," adding that Dallas is "in position to look at a trade" to help a struggling defense that is second to last in points allowed per game.

articles.title: Rodgers, Flacco happy to be part of 'Icy Hot bowl'
articles.summary: In Thursday night's Steelers-Bengals matchup, Aaron Rodgers and Joe Flacco will become just the second pair of opposing quarterbacks 40 or older in NFL history to start a regular or postseason game against each other.

articles.title: WR Moore back in Chicago after night in hospital
articles.summary: Bears wide receiver DJ Moore is back in Chicago after spending the night in a Washington, D.C.-area hospital where he was evaluated for a groin injury, according to coach Ben Johnson.
